page.title: 19THE "HAREFIELD"
page.content: Four open hatch bulk carriers were commissioned in the early 1980's to be built by Hyundai Heavy Industries of South Korea.The ships were to be named after English villages ending in "field".The four villages chosen were Chelsfield, Harefield, Petersfield and Westfield. The "Harefield" was launched late in 1984 and in March 1985 made her maiden voyage to Avonmouth.The Buries Markes Ship Management Co. presented Harefield History Society with a commemorative medal and a copy of the entry in Lloyds List. It is intended by the society to frame the medal together with a picture of the vessel and display it in either the library or St. Mary's Church.
